. // Fig 1b
. ** Global carbon price and temperature rise 
. * Global Generate variable defining position of observations on x-axis
. egen carbon_price_rank = rank(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped) unique

. egen temp_rise_cropped_freq = count(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. gen  temp_rise_cropped_jitter2 = temp_rise_cropped + (carbon_price_rank *.006) - (temp_rise_cropped_freq / 2 * 0.006)

. 
. * National: Generate variable defining position of observations on x-axis
. foreach var in now future {
  2. egen price_rank_h_`var' = rank(price_home_`var'_cap), unique
  3. }

. 
. gen h_now_jitter = .
(276 missing values generated)

. replace h_now_jitter = .5 + (price_rank_h_now *.001)
(276 real changes made)

. gen h_future_jitter = .
(276 missing values generated)

. replace h_future_jitter = 1 + (price_rank_h_future * .001)
(276 real changes made)

. gen h_now_stat = .
(276 missing values generated)

. replace h_now_stat = .6
(276 real changes made)

. gen h_future_stat = .
(276 missing values generated)

. replace h_future_stat = 1.1
(276 real changes made)

. 
. 
. * Save number of observations in locals
. forvalues i = 1/6 {
  2. sum ln_carbon_price if tr`i' == 1
  3. local n_`i' = r(N)
  4. }

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         22    3.323065    2.261287          0   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         36    3.722019    2.127395   .6931472   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         42    4.207788    1.800718   1.098612   7.601402

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |        115    4.116706    1.364998          0   7.313887

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         40    3.659859    1.407166          0   6.552508

    Variable |        Obs        Mean    Std. Dev.       Min        Max
-------------+---------------------------------------------------------
ln_carbon_~e |         21    3.544467    1.325008   .6931472   6.908755

. twoway ///
> (scatter carbon_price_cap temp_rise_cropped_jitter2 , mcolor(%30) msize(medium) msymbol(o)) ///
> (scatter mean_carbon_price temp_rise_cropped , mcolor("119 94 239") mlcolor("94 64 201")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(triangle))                           ///
> (scatter median_carbon_price temp_rise_cropped , mcolor("220 38 127") mlcolor("208 17 111")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(square))                           ///
> , title("{bf:b }", pos(11) span size($head pt))                                             ///
> ytitle("Global carbon price to stay below" "stated temperat. target (USD/tCO2)", size($xytitle pt))                               ///
> ylabel(, labsize($xylab pt))                                                                ///
> xtitle("Temperature rise deemed acceptable (°C)", size($xytitle pt)  margin(0 0 0 4))       ///
> xlabel(1 `" "0°C" "(n=`n_1')" "' 2 `" "0.5°C" "(n=`n_2')" "'  3 `" "1°C" "(n=`n_3')" "' 4 `" "1.5°C" "(n=`n_4')" "' 5 `" "2°C" "(n=`n_5')" "' 6 `" "{&ge}2.5°C" "(n=`n_6')" "' , labsize(
> 2.1 pt))                                         ///
> xscale(range(0.85 6.2 )) ///
> legend(order(1 "Observation" 2 "Mean" 3 "Median") size($legend pt) rows(1) pos(6) ring(1) region(fcolor(%40))) ///
> fysize(45) fxsize(40) scale(*1.25) graphregion(margin(0 0 1.3 0) fcolor(none) lcolor(none)) plotregion(margin(0 0 0 0)) 

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\price_temprise", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Donia_Delegates\8_Submission\NSUST\analysis\results\intermediate\price_temprise.gph saved)

. 
. 
. * National carbon prices home (now/future)
. twoway ///
> (scatter price_home_now_cap h_now_jitter , mcolor(purple%30) msize(medium) msymbol(o))  ///
> (scatter mean_price_home_now h_now_stat , mcolor("119 94 239") mlcolor("94 64 201")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(triangle))                    ///
> (scatter median_price_home_now h_now_stat , mcolor("220 38 127") mlcolor("208 17 111")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(square))                        ///
> (scatter price_home_future_cap h_future_jitter , mcolor(orange%30) msize(medium) msymbol(o)) ///
> (scatter mean_price_home_future h_future_stat , mcolor("119 94 239") mlcolor("94 64 201")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(triangle))                  ///
> (scatter median_price_home_future h_future_stat , mcolor("220 38 127") mlcolor("208 17 111")  mlwidth(medium) msymbol(square))                  ///
> , title("{bf: }", pos(11) span size($head pt))                                   ///
> ytitle("National carbon price to stay below" "2°C temp. target (USD/tCO2)", size($xytitle pt))            ///
> ylabel(, labsize($xylab pt)) yscale(alt) ///
> xtitle("Time period", size($xytitle pt)  margin(0 0 0 4)) ///
> xlabel(.6 "Now" 1.1 "Future", labsize(8 pt)) xscale(range(0.47 1.3)) ///
> legend(off) ///
> fysize(45) fxsize(20) scale(*1.25) graphregion(margin(6 0 13.3 3.6) fcolor(none) lcolor(none)) plotregion(margin(0 0 0 0)) nodraw

. graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\global_price", replace
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Donia_Delegates\8_Submission\NSUST\analysis\results\intermediate\global_price.gph saved)

. // Fig. 1c. Marginsplot global carbon price and home carbon price deemed necessary 
. * Set globals
. global info_source info_cc_1 info_cc_2 info_cc_3 info_cc_4 info_cc_5

. global socioeconomics edu1 edu3 edu4 edu5 // Education ref. cat.: edu2 (Social Sciences); gender and age erased to not jepardize anonimity of participants

. global orga orga2 orga3 orga4 // Governmental organization ref. cat.

. global countryspecifics lower_middle_income upper_middle_income high_income // Income level: ref.cat: low

. 
. 
. * Probit, DV: Global carbon price 
. quietly: probit price_below temp_above tech_ms_pca $info_source $orga cops_attended $socioeconomics i.income , vce(robust)

. eststo p1: margins, dydx(tech_ms_pca) post

. * Marginsplot
. coefplot(p1, offset(-0.3)) (p2, offset(0)) (p3, offset(.3)), legend(order(3 "Average marginal effect" 1 "95% Confidence interval" 2 "90% Confidence interval") size($legend pt) rows(3) r
> owgap(tiny) pos(6) ring(1) region(fcolor(%40))) title("{bf:c} ", pos(11) span size($head pt))  byopts(compact rows(1)) yline(0, lpattern(dash) lcolor(gs3)) ylabel(-.02(.02).1, labsize($
> xylab pt)) xlab(.7 "Global" 1 "National now" 1.3 "National future", labsize($xylab pt)) ytitle("Estimated impact: Tech. optimism" "and proposing carbon price < 60USD", size($xytitle pt)
> ) grid(none) levels(95 90) ciopts(lwidth(0.8 2)  lcolor(*1 *.3) recast(rcap)) mlabel(cond(@pval<.01, "***", cond(@pval<.05, "**", cond(@pval<.1, "*", "")))) msize(3pt) msymbol(D) mlabsi
> ze(10pt) mlabposition(2) subtitle(, size(9pt) lstyle(none) margin(small) nobox justification(center) alignment(top) bmargin(top)) vertical graphregion(margin(15 2 0 0) fcolor(none) lcol
> or(none)) plotregion(margin(0 0 0 0)) scale(*1.25) fysize(80)

. // "Respondents with higher technological optimism showed a significant preference for recommending the book advocating for incremental changes based on efficiency to address ecological
>  problems (“More from Less” by Andrew McAfee), while being less likely to suggest the alternative which calls for transformative solutions and re-thinking our economies"
. ttest tech_ms_pca, by(book2) // More from less

. // An increase in the technological optimist mindset by one is linked to a greater likelihood of suggesting global carbon prices below 60 USD

. ** DV: Global carbon price suggested below USD60
. probit price_below temp_rise book1 book3 $info_source $orga cops_attended $socioeconomics $countryspecifics treat_tech, vce(robust)

. ************************************************************
. *        S4 Additional Analysis and Robustness Tests       *
. ************************************************************
. * Set globals
. global info_source info_cc_1 info_cc_2 info_cc_3 info_cc_4 info_cc_5

. global socioeconomics female age edu1 edu3 edu4 edu5 // Education ref. cat.: edu2 (Social Sciences)

. global orga orga2 orga3 orga4 // Governmental organization ref. cat.

. global countryspecifics i.income co2_pc ln_science freedom_house_index

. 
. 
. // S4.1 Temperature rise deemed acceptable
. * Table S4. Effects of technological optimism mindset on temperature rise deemed acceptable.
. * Binary model [Temp-rise >= 2°C]

> Appendix:
>   S2 Sample details
>         o Table S1. Summary statistics
>     o Table S2. Countries’ classification by income level (countries erased here for reasons of anonymity)

>   S3 Measurement details
>         o 3.1 PCA Generation Mindset (Fig S2) & Distribution answers
>         o 3.1 Validation Mindset measures: Books recommendations (Fig S3)
>         o 3.2 PCA Generation Negotiation Style (Fig S4)
> 
>   S4 Additional analysis and robustness checks
>     o 4.1 Determinants of the mindset (Table S2)
>         o 4.2 Temperature rise deemed acceptable
>                 o Main regression outcomes (Table S3)
>                 o Robustness-test using (quasi-)continious variables (Table S4)
>     o 4.3 Carbon price suggested
>                 o Main regression outcomes (Table S5)
>                 o Robustness-test using (quasi-)continious variables (Table S6)

>                 o Robustness-test using (quasi-)continious variables (Table S10)

. * Text size: A & C
. global head     10 // Title

. global legend    8 // Legend

. global xytitle   8 // Axis title

. global xylab     8 // Scale label

. 
. * Text size: B (A&C * 2/3)
. global ratio_abc = 3/4

. display $ratio_abc * $head
7.5

. display $ratio_abc * $legend  
6

. display $ratio_abc * $xytitle
6

. display $ratio_abc * $xylab  
6

. 
. global head2    7.5  // Title

. global legend2  6    // Legend

. global xytitle2 6    // Axis title

. global xylab2   6    // Scale label

. // Figure S1. Origin of participants and distribution of characteristics in our sample and in the COP 24 population
. * To protect anonymity of participants, countries have been erased. Therefore, the following command producing Figure S1 cannot be executed with th
> e dataset uploaded. For reasons of transparency, we still report the code used to produce the map.
. 
. /*
> * A. Origin of population
> /* Only needs to be run once to create _db & _co
> * Download dara for map from: https://github.com/riatelab/world
> cd "$working_ANALYSIS\data\GitHub"
> shp2dta using country.shp, database(world_db) coordinates(world_co) genid(id)
> */
> 
> *preserve
> use "$working_ANALYSIS\data\GitHub\world_db" , clear
> rename name country_home
> 
> ** Unify country names
> replace country_home = "Congo" if country_home == "Republic of Congo"
> replace country_home = "Czechia" if country_home == "Czech Republic"
> replace country_home = "Côte d’Ivoire" if country_home == "Cte d'Ivoire"
> replace country_home = "Gambia" if country_home == "The Gambia"
> replace country_home = "Lao People's Democratic Republic" if country_home == "Laos"
> replace country_home = "Micronesia" if country_home == "Federated States of Micronesia"
> replace country_home = "Republic of Korea" if country_home == "South Korea"
> replace country_home = "Viet Nam" if country_home == "Vietnam"
> 
> 
> ** Merge with dataset
> merge 1:m country_home using "$working_ANALYSIS\data\delegates_analysis_complete.dta"
> 
> gen observation = .
> replace observation = 1 if temp_rise != .
> egen obs_country = count(observation), by(country_home)
> replace obs_country = . if obs_country == 0
> 
> collapse (mean) obs_country, by(country_home id) 
> 
> spmap obs_country using world_co if country_home != "Antarctica", id(id) fcolor(Blues2) ///
> clmethod(custom) clbreaks(0 1 2 3 6.1 9.1 12) ///
> legend(symy(*1.5) symx(*1.5) size(*1.5)) legorder(lohi)  ///
> legend(label(2 "1") label(3 "2" ) label(4 "3") label(5 "4 - 6") label(6 "7 - 9") label(7 "10 - 12")) ///
> osize(0.1pt ..) ndfcolor(white) ndocolor(gs5) ndsize(0.2pt) legstyle(2) legtitle("Observation") title("{bf:a}", size(11pt) pos(11) span)
> graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1a", replace
> 
> // Comparision of distributions our sample vs. COP24 population
> use "$working_ANALYSIS\data\delegates_analysis_complete.dta", clear
> gen sample = 1
> append using "$working_ANALYSIS\data\cop24_parties.dta"
> replace sample = 2 if sample == .
> 
> 
> // Figure S1b: Global North vs. Global South
> tab global_south, gen(gs)
> graph bar (mean) gs1 gs2, over(sample, relabel(1 "Our Sample" 2 "COP24")) blabel(bar, format(%3.2g)) ytitle("Share") title("{bf:b}", size(10pt) spa
> n pos(11))  legend(order(1 "Global North" 2 "Global South") rows(2)) nodraw
> graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1b", replace
> 
> 
> // Figure S1c: Male vs. Female
> tab female, gen(fem)
> graph bar (mean) fem1 fem2, over(sample, relabel(1 "Our Sample" 2 "COP24")) blabel(bar, format(%3.2g)) ytitle("Share") title("{bf:c}", size(10pt) s
> pan pos(11))  legend(order(1 "Male" 2 "Female") rows(2)) nodraw
> graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1c", replace
>  
> // Figure S1d: Governmental vs. Other
> replace non_gov = (orga1 - 1) * (-1) if sample == 1
> tab non_gov, gen(non_gov)
> graph bar (mean) non_gov1 non_gov2, over(sample, relabel(1 "Our Sample" 2 "COP24")) blabel(bar, format(%3.2g)) ytitle("Share") title("{bf:d}", size
> (10pt) span pos(11))  legend(order(1 "Governmental" 2 "Other") rows(2)) nodraw
> graph save "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1d", replace
> 
> * Combine B,C & D
> graph combine "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1b" "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1c" "$working_ANALYSIS\results\in
> termediate\Figure S1d", rows(1) iscale(1.1)
> gr save  "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1bcd", replace
> 
> 
> * Combine A with B,C&D
> graph combine "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1a"  "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1bcd", cols(1)
> gr save  "$working_ANALYSIS\results\intermediate\Figure S1", replace
> gr export "$working_ANALYSIS\results\figures\Figure S1.tif", replace
> 
> 
> // Test for stat. diffs
> ttest global_south, by(sample)
> ttest female, by(sample)
> ttest non_gov, by(sample)
> */
. 
. 
. 
.

. twoway (dropline Comp1 var_nr , horizontal mlabel(Comp1) mlabformat(%12.2f) mlabposition(top)) , ylabel(1(1)5, valuelabel) xlabel(0(0.2)0.6) xtitle
> (loadings) ytitle("") ysize(2) scale(*1.4)

. gr_edit yaxis1.edit_tick 1 1 `""Future generations will be richer and better equipped" "to deal with adverse impacts of climate change.""', tickset
> (major)

. gr_edit yaxis1.edit_tick 1 2 `""Technological innovation e.g., solar geoengineering offers" "a suitable solution to respond in case of a future cli
> mate emergency.""', tickset(major)

. gr_edit yaxis1.edit_tick 1 3 `""The present costs and future benefits to society must be weighed" "against each other, while deciding about emissio
> n reduction policies.""', tickset(major)

. gr_edit yaxis1.edit_tick 1 4 `""Technological innovations for climate change emerge more likely" "in a free-market economy without much interferenc
> e from the Government.""', tickset(major)

. gr_edit yaxis1.edit_tick 1 5 `""The transformation towards a sustainable society is possible by making productions" "more resourcesaving and withou
> t harming the economy (e.g. constant growth).""', tickset(major)

. // Figure S3. Book recommendation and technological optimism
. gen book_2 = .
(276 missing values generated)

. replace book_2 = 1 if book == 2
(80 real changes made)

. replace book_2 = 2 if book == 1
(113 real changes made)

. replace book_2 = 3 if book == 3
(83 real changes made)

. 
. stripplot tech_ms_pca, over(book_2) separate(book_2) mcolor(gs8*.35 gs8*.35 gs8*.35) msymbol(o o o) yla(-5(1)3 , nogrid) xtitle("") ytitle("Technol
> ogical optimism") vertical center cumul cumprob bar boffset(.4) refline(lw(medium) lc(gs10) lp(solid)) reflinestretch(0.1) xla(, noticks) yla(, ang
> (h)) title("") xlab(1 "More from less (n=82)" 2 `""Good Economics for" "hard times (n=114)""' 3 "Dougnut Economics (n=84)") legend(order(4 "Observa
> tion" 3 "Mean" 2 "95% Confidence Interval" )) yline(0, lpattern(dash) lcolor(gs3*.4)) ysize(3) scale(*1.2)

. graph export "$working_ANALYSIS/results/figures/Figure S3.tif", replace width(3650)
(file C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper SustUse\Donia_Delegates\8_Submission\NSUST\analysis/results/figures/Figure S3.tif
>  written in TIFF format)

. 
. ttest tech_ms_pca if book != 1, by(book) // (2) More from less vs. (3) Doughnut Economics 

Two-sample t test with equal variances
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   Group |     Obs        Mean    Std. Err.   Std. Dev.   [95% Conf. Interval]
---------+--------------------------------------------------------------------
More fro |      80    .3908448    .1491937    1.334429     .093882    .6878075
Doughnut |      83   -.4182654    .1687681     1.53755   -.7539989   -.0825319
---------+--------------------------------------------------------------------
combined |     163   -.0211561    .1169555    1.493188     -.25211    .2097977
---------+--------------------------------------------------------------------
    diff |            .8091102    .2258465                .3631067    1.255114
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
    diff = mean(More fro) - mean(Doughnut)                        t =   3.5826
Ho: diff = 0                                     degrees of freedom =      161

. ** Figure S5: Detailed view on global carbon prices named for the section 0USD to 50USD
. 
. * Global carbon price and temperature rise 
. * Global Generate variable defining position of observations on x-axis
. egen carbon_price_rank = rank(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped) unique

. egen temp_rise_cropped_freq = count(carbon_price_cap), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. gen  temp_rise_cropped_jitter2 = temp_rise_cropped + (carbon_price_rank *.006) - (temp_rise_cropped_freq / 2 * 0.006)

. 
. forvalues i = 1/6 {
  2. sum ln_carbon_price if tr`i' == 1
  3. local n_`i' = r(N)
  4. }

. ** Table S7. Effects of technological optimism mindset on global carbon prices excluding participants naming ambitious temperature targets (≤1.5°C)
>  and low global carbon prices at the same time
. foreach x in 1 5 10 20 30 40 50 {
  2.         gen price_below_`x' = 0
  3.         replace price_below_`x' = 1 if carbon_price < `x' & temp_rise <= 2
  4. }

. * Organization currently working for
. gen orga = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace orga = 1 if organization == 1 | organization == 2 // International (11) & national (168) gov orga 
(179 real changes made)

. replace orga = 2 if organization == 3 //  University/Research Institute
(33 real changes made)

. replace orga = 3 if organization == 5 //  Environmental NGO
(25 real changes made)

. replace orga = 4 if organization == 4 |  organization == 6 |  organization == 7 //  Private Company (n=8), Non-environmental 
> NGO (n=6), Other (n=26)
(40 real changes made)

. tab organization

         Type of organization |
        currently working for |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
  Internat. Gov. Organization |         11        3.97        3.97
       Nat. Gov. Organization |        168       60.65       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
              Private Company |          8        2.89       79.42
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       88.45
        Non-Environmental NGO |          6        2.17       90.61
                        Other |         26        9.39      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. lab define orga_lab 1 "Governmental Organization" 2 "University/Research Institute" 3 "Environmental NGO" 4 "Other"

. lab val orga orga_lab

. tab orga, gen(orga)

                         orga |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
    Governmental Organization |        179       64.62       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       85.56
                        Other |         40       14.44      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. 
. 
. 
. // Temperature rise deemed acceptable
. * Binary variable being 1 if temperature rise above 1.5 degrees is deemed acceptable and 0 otherwise
. gen temp_above = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace temp_above = 0 if temp_rise <= 1.5
(216 real changes made)

. replace temp_above = 1 if temp_rise > 1.5
(61 real changes made)

. lab var temp_above "Temperature rise above 1.5°C deemed acceptable"

. 
. * Cropped temperature rise deemed acceptable
. /*
> Very few people suggested temperatures of 2.5°C or higher to be acceptable:
> 2.5°C -> 9
> 3.0°C -> 4
> 3.5°C -> 2
> 4.0°C -> 2
> 4.5°C -> 0
> 5.0°C -> 4
> Therefore, for the illustration Figure 1a all temperature suggestions of 2.5°C or more are summarized under >= 2.5°C
> */
. gen temp_rise2 = temp_rise

. replace temp_rise2 = 2.5 if temp_rise >= 2.5
(12 real changes made)

. tostring temp_rise2, gen(temp_rise3)
temp_rise3 generated as str3

. sort temp_rise

. lab define temp 1 "0" 2 ".5" 3 "1" 4 "1.5", replace

. encode temp_rise3, gen(temp_rise_cropped) lab(temp)

. lab var temp_rise_cropped"All those suggesting 2.5 or more collected in 2.5"

. drop temp_rise2 temp_rise3

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Global carbon price suggested
. * Logarithmic form of suggested carbon prices
. gen ln_carbon_price = ln(carbon_price + 1)

. label var ln_carbon_price "Natural logarithm of suggested carbon_price"

. 
. * Cropping global carbon price suggested at USD500 for visualization in figure 1b
. gen carbon_price_cap = carbon_price

. replace carbon_price_cap  = 501 if carbon_price > 500
(23 real changes made)

. lab var carbon_price_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"

. egen mean_carbon_price = mean(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var mean_carbon_price "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"

. egen median_carbon_price = median(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var median_carbon_price "Median carbon price (non-capped)"

. tab temp_rise_cropped , gen(tr)

  All those |
 suggesting |
2.5 or more |
  collected |
     in 2.5 |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |         22        7.94        7.94
         .5 |         36       13.00       20.94
          1 |         42       15.16       36.10
        1.5 |        116       41.88       77.98
          2 |         40       14.44       92.42
        2.5 |         21        7.58      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |        277      100.00

. 
. 
. * Cropping area-specific carbon prices at USD500 for visualization in figure 1c
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future price_oecd_future price_ldc_future ln_carbon_pri
> ce {
  2. gen `var'_cap = `var'
  3. replace `var'_cap  = 501 if `var' > 500
  4. lab var `var'_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"
  5. egen mean_`var' = mean(`var')
  6. lab var mean_`var' "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"
  7. egen median_`var' = median(`var')
  8. lab var median_`var' "Median carbon price (non-capped)"
  9. }
(13 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(11 real changes made)
(25 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)

. 
. 
. * Binary variable being 1 if global carbon price below 60 USD suggested
. gen price_below = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace price_below = 0 if carbon_price >= 60 
(126 real changes made)

. replace price_below = 1 if carbon_price < 60 
(151 real changes made)

. lab var price_below "Price suggested < USD60"

. 
. * Binary variable being 1 if national carbon prices (now & future) below 60 USD suggested
. foreach var in now future {
  2.         gen price_below_home_`var' = .
  3.         replace price_below_home_`var' = 0 if price_home_`var' >= 60
  4.         replace price_below_home_`var' = 1 if price_home_`var' < 60
  5.         lab var price_below_home_`var' "Price suggested < USD60"
  6.         }
(277 missing values generated)
(79 real changes made)
(198 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(126 real changes made)
(151 real changes made)

. 
. 
. /*
> Carbon price suggestions tested
> Different models suggest different minimal global carbon prices to stay below a certain temperature rise. In the main paper w
> e use USD60 as thte threshold. As robustness test, we also test against other specifications: 37 USD 82 USD, 185 USD, 281 USD
> */
. foreach i in 37 60 82 185 281 {
  2.         gen price_below_`i' = .
  3.                 replace price_below_`i'= 1 if carbon_price < `i'
  4.                 replace price_below_`i'= 0 if carbon_price >=  `i'
  5.         lab var price_below_`i' "Price below USD `i' suggested"
  6. }
(277 missing values generated)
(119 real changes made)
(158 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(151 real changes made)
(126 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(175 real changes made)
(102 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(224 real changes made)
(53 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(241 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)

. // Region- and time-specific carbon price suggestions
. ** Logarithms of prices suggested prices for home, OECD, LDC / now, future
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future price_oecd_future price_ldc_future {
  2. gen ln_`var' = log(`var' + 1)
  3. }

. lab var ln_price_home_now "Ln of Price Home Now"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_now "Ln of Price OECD Now"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_now "Ln of Price LDCs Now"

. lab var ln_price_home_future "Ln of Price Home Future"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_future "Ln of Price OECD Future"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_future "Ln of Price LDCs Future"

. 
. 
. 
. * Average carbon price
. alpha carbon_price carbon_price price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future price_oecd_future price_ldc_fut
> ure, gen(carbon_price_mean)

Test scale = mean(unstandardized items)

Average interitem covariance:     93673.63
Number of items in the scale:            7
Scale reliability coefficient:      0.9287

. 
. * Average carbon price (log)
. alpha ln_carbon_price ln_carbon_price ln_price_home_now ln_price_oecd_now ln_price_ldc_now ln_price_home_future ln_price_oecd
> _future ln_price_ldc_future, gen(ln_carbon_price_mean)

Test scale = mean(unstandardized items)

Average interitem covariance:     2.065777
Number of items in the scale:            7
Scale reliability coefficient:      0.9486

. // Principal components
. ** Technological optimism

. * Program Setup

. clear all               

. *version 16              // Set Version number for backward compatibility
. set more off            

. set linesize 80         

. macro drop _all        

. set matsize 2000
set matsize ignored.
    Matrix sizes are no longer limited by c(matsize) in modern Statas.  Matrix
    sizes are now limited by flavor of Stata.  See limits for more details.

. * -------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Directory
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. * Max (G-Drive)
. global stata "C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delega
> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA"

. global workpath   "$stata\DO-FILES"

. global datapath   "$stata\DTA-FILES"

. global output     "$stata\OUTPUT"

. global xls        "$stata\XLS-FILES"

. 
.

.

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Description
. *--------------------------------------------------
. /*
> I) Importing files
> II) Appending files to one dataset
> III) Cleaning
>         i) Renaming & Encoding
> IV) Unifying country-names and assigning to continents
> V) Merge country-specifics
> */
. *--------------------------------------------------

. *--------
. * I. Importing files
. *-------------
. *** Treatment 1: Environment
. ** Own delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Own delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) clear
(115 vars, 69 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on environmetnal caution (1) compared to techn. o
> pt. (0)"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Envir. caut" 0 "Tech. Opt"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=1

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", replace
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta saved

. append using "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq002 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable b4sq004 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd14sq001_sq001 was str21, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str18, now str29 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd6sq004 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6sq006 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6other was str44, now str168 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable lastname was str16, now str30 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_own.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq003 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)

       values)
(note: variable sd1other was str86, now str103 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd3other was str50, now str62 to accommodate using data's
       values)

       data's values)
(note: variable sd571058comment was str36, now str41 to accommodate using
       data's values)

       data's values)

(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_others.dta", force
(note: variable sd1 was str6, now str17 to accommodate using data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str29, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5sq001comment was str69, now str105 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str60, now str81 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory                
>   nagla_fnc@yahoo.com
> 05.11.2020      Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain  Jebory                  nagla_fnc@yaho
> o.com
> 
> 06.11.2020      Augustin                                Ngenzirabona    augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 25.03.2021      Ngenzirablna                    Augustin                augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 
> Keep first entry of each
> */
. drop if firstname == "Ram" & lastname == "Awasthi"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain" & lastname == "Jebory"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Ngenzirablna" & lastname == "Augustin"
(1 observation deleted)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *** Generate ID
. gen id = _n

. lab var id "ID"

. 
. 
. *** i) Encoding
. ** veryimportant => very important; somewhatunimportant => somewhat unimportan
> t
. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. replace `var'="Very important" if `var'=="Veryimportant"
  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }
(161 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0011 was str19 now str20
(4 real changes made)
(7 real changes made)
(219 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0021 was str19 now str20
(1 real change made)
(0 real changes made)
(190 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0031 was str19 now str20
(2 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(157 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0041 was str19 now str20
(8 real changes made)
(6 real changes made)
(144 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0051 was str19 now str20
(10 real changes made)
(4 real changes made)

. 
. ** Importance of environmental projection
. label define important 1 "Not important at all" 2 "Somewhat unimportant" 3 "Ne
> utral" 4 "Somewhat important" 5 "Very important"

. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(important)
  3. }

. 
. rename ta1sq0011_enc env_ms_1

. label var env_ms_1 "Environmental events that historically happened once per c
> entury will occur at least once per year by 2050."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0021_enc env_ms_2

. label var env_ms_2 "Besides greenhouse gas emissions, the earth is approaching
>  many planetary boundaries that demand equal attention"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0031_enc env_ms_3

. label var env_ms_3 "200 million migrants will be moving either within their co

. replace book2 = 0 if book==1 | book==3
(197 real changes made)

. label var book2 "More from less, a new reason for optimism"

. 
. gen book3 =.
(277 missing values generated)

. replace book3  = 1 if book==3
(84 real changes made)

. replace book3  = 0 if book==1 | book==2
(193 real changes made)

. label var book3  "Doughnut Economics, Economics is broken- necessity of humani
> ty to fix the planet"

. 
. * Treatment
. gen treat_tech = (t_env - 1) *(-1)

. lab var treat_tech "Technological optimism made salient (compared to env. caut
> ion)"

. lab define tech_opt 0 "Env. caution" 1 "Techn. optimism"

. lab val treat_tech tech_opt

.

. * Comments

. lab var comment "Open comment"

. lab def conti 1 "Africa" 2 "Asia" 3 "Europe" 4 "North America" 5 "South Americ
> a" 6 "Oceania", replace

. encode continent, gen(continent2) lab(conti)

. drop continent

. rename continent2 continent

. lab var continent "Continent"

. // Set "don't knows" to missings

. // Development level / Glob. South vs. North (following: UNCTAD https://unctad

> e(C4:D2410) firstrow case(lower) clear
(2 vars, 2,406 obs)

. gen development = .
(2,406 missing values generated)

. replace development = 1 if id > 739  & id < 811
(71 real changes made)

. replace development = 2 if id > 994  & id < 1128
(133 real changes made)

. replace development = 3 if id > 1128 & id < 1182
(53 real changes made)

. lab val development dev

. lab var development "Development status"

. 
. gen global_south = .
(2,406 missing values generated)

. replace global_south = 0 if development == 1
(71 real changes made)

(186 real changes made)

. lab define global 0 "Global North" 1 "Global South"

. lab val global_south global 

.

(2,149 observations deleted)

. destring yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019, replace
yr2015: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(330 missing values generated)

(338 missing values generated)

(338 missing values generated)

(341 missing values generated)
yr2019: all characters numeric; replaced as double
(586 missing values generated)

. encode countrycode, generate(country_code)

. egen average = rowmean(yr2015 yr2016 yr2017 yr2018 yr2019)
(329 missing values generated)

. keep countryname average seriesname

. drop if countryname == ""
(3 observations deleted)

. 
. * Reshape to wide
. egen indicator = group(seriesname)
(2 missing values generated)

. drop if indicator == . // Datasource information
(2 observations deleted)

. 
. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
. 
. drop seriesname 

. encode countryname , gen(country_code)

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

. 
. * Unify variable names
. rename countryname country_home

. label var country_home "Home country"

. drop country_code

. order country_home

. 
. rename average1 co2_emissionpc

. label var co2_emissionpc "CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)"

. 
. drop average2 // no values for countries in dataset

. 
. rename average3 gdp

. label var gdp "GDP (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average4 gdp_growth

. label var gdp_growth "GDP growth (annual %)"

. 
. rename average5 gdppc

. label var gdppc "GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)"

. 
. rename average6 population

. label var population "Population, total"

.

> e5 negotiate6 negotiate7 ///

> city_gain vuln_gain readiness_gain gain_index cri_rank cri_score fatalities_20
> 18_rank fatalaties_pc losses_total losses_gdp oecd ldc income_level low_income
>  lower_middle_income upper_middle_income high_income control_corr gov_effect f
> uel_exporting resource_rich g77 science co2_pc control_corrupt gov_effect pol_
> stab reg_qual rule_of_law voice_account inst_qual_mean freedom_house_status fr
> eedom_house_index innovation_index innovation_rank polity_index development gl

. // Sociodemographics
. * Education
. tab edu, generate(edu)

     Field in which |
  highes degree was |
           obtained |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
--------------------+-----------------------------------
    Natural Science |        126       45.49       45.49
     Social Science |         55       19.86       65.34
Mix: Social&Natural |         47       16.97       82.31
                Law |         26        9.39       91.70
              Other |         23        8.30      100.00
--------------------+-----------------------------------
              Total |        277      100.00

. 
. * Organization currently working for
. gen orga = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace orga = 1 if organization == 1 | organization == 2 // International (11
> ) & national (168) gov orga 
(179 real changes made)

. replace orga = 2 if organization == 3 //  University/Research Institute
(33 real changes made)

. replace orga = 3 if organization == 5 //  Environmental NGO
(25 real changes made)

. replace orga = 4 if organization == 4 |  organization == 6 |  organization == 
> 7 //  Private Company (n=8), Non-environmental NGO (n=6), Other (n=26)
(40 real changes made)

. tab organization

         Type of organization |
        currently working for |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
  Internat. Gov. Organization |         11        3.97        3.97
       Nat. Gov. Organization |        168       60.65       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
              Private Company |          8        2.89       79.42
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       88.45
        Non-Environmental NGO |          6        2.17       90.61
                        Other |         26        9.39      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. lab define orga_lab 1 "Governmental Organization" 2 "University/Research Insti
> tute" 3 "Environmental NGO" 4 "Other"

. lab val orga orga_lab

. tab orga, gen(orga)

                         orga |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
    Governmental Organization |        179       64.62       64.62
University/Research Institute |         33       11.91       76.53
            Environmental NGO |         25        9.03       85.56
                        Other |         40       14.44      100.00
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
                        Total |        277      100.00

. 
.

. // Temperature rise deemed acceptable
. ** Temperature above 1.5 degrees
. gen temp_above = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace temp_above = 0 if temp_rise <= 1.5
(216 real changes made)

. replace temp_above = 1 if temp_rise > 1.5
(61 real changes made)

. lab var temp_above "Temperature rise above 1.5°C deemed acceptable"

. 
. /*
> Very few people suggested temperatures of 2.5°C or higher to be acceptable:
> 2.5°C -> 9
> 3.0°C -> 4
> 3.5°C -> 2
> 4.0°C -> 2
> 4.5°C -> 0
> 5.0°C -> 4
> Therefore, for the illustration Figure 1a all temperature suggestions of 2.5°C
>  or more are summarized under >= 2.5°C
> */
. gen temp_rise2 = temp_rise

. replace temp_rise2 = 2.5 if temp_rise >= 2.5
(12 real changes made)

. tostring temp_rise2, gen(temp_rise3)
temp_rise3 generated as str3

. sort temp_rise

. lab define temp 1 "0" 2 ".5" 3 "1" 4 "1.5", replace

. encode temp_rise3, gen(temp_rise_cropped) lab(temp)

. lab var temp_rise_cropped"All those suggesting 2.5 or more collected in 2.5"

. drop temp_rise2 temp_rise3

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Global carbon price suggested
. ** Logarithmic form of suggested carbon prices
. gen ln_carbon_price = ln(carbon_price + 1)

. label var ln_carbon_price "Natural logarithm of suggested carbon_price"

. 
. ** Cropping global carbon price suggested at USD500 for visualization in figur
> e 1b
. gen carbon_price_cap = carbon_price

. replace carbon_price_cap  = 501 if carbon_price > 500
(23 real changes made)

. lab var carbon_price_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"

. egen mean_carbon_price = mean(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var mean_carbon_price "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"

. egen median_carbon_price = median(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var median_carbon_price "Median carbon price (non-capped)"

. tab temp_rise_cropped , gen(tr)

  All those |
 suggesting |
2.5 or more |
  collected |
     in 2.5 |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |         22        7.94        7.94
         .5 |         36       13.00       20.94
          1 |         42       15.16       36.10
        1.5 |        116       41.88       77.98
          2 |         40       14.44       92.42
        2.5 |         21        7.58      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |        277      100.00

. 
. 
. ** Cropping area-specific carbon prices at USD500 for visualization in figure 
> 1c
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future p
> rice_oecd_future price_ldc_future ln_carbon_price {
  2. gen `var'_cap = `var'
  3. replace `var'_cap  = 501 if `var' > 500
  4. lab var `var'_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"
  5. egen mean_`var' = mean(`var')
  6. lab var mean_`var' "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"
  7. egen median_`var' = median(`var')
  8. lab var median_`var' "Median carbon price (non-capped)"
  9. }
(13 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(11 real changes made)
(25 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)

. 
. 
. * Average carbon price
. alpha carbon_price carbon_price price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now pr
> ice_home_future price_oecd_future price_ldc_future, gen(carbon_price_mean)

Test scale = mean(unstandardized items)

Average interitem covariance:     93673.63
Number of items in the scale:            7
Scale reliability coefficient:      0.9287

. 
. * Average carbon price (log)
. alpha ln_carbon_price ln_carbon_price ln_price_home_now ln_price_oecd_now ln_p
> rice_ldc_now ln_price_home_future ln_price_oecd_future ln_price_ldc_future, ge
> n(ln_carbon_price_mean)
variable ln_price_home_now not found
r(111);

end of do-file

    Matrix sizes are no longer limited by c(matsize) in modern Statas.  Matrix
    sizes are now limited by flavor of Stata.  See limits for more details.

> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA"

> ion (0)"

       values)

       values)

       values)

       values)

       values)

       values)

       values)

       values)

       data's values)

       data's values)

       data's values)

(note: variable sd1 was str6, now str17 to accommodate using data's values)

       data's values)

       data's values)

       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. 
. 
.

. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory                
>   nagla_fnc@yahoo.com
> 05.11.2020      Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain  Jebory                  nagla_fnc@yaho
> o.com
> 
> 06.11.2020      Augustin                                Ngenzirabona    augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 25.03.2021      Ngenzirablna                    Augustin                augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 
> Keep first entry of each
> */
. drop if firstname == "Ram" & lastname == "Awasthi"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain" & lastname == "Jebory"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Ngenzirablna" & lastname == "Augustin"
(1 observation deleted)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *** Generate ID
. gen id = _n

. lab var id "ID"

. 
. 
. *** i) Encoding
. ** veryimportant => very important; somewhatunimportant => somewhat unimportan
> t
. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. replace `var'="Very important" if `var'=="Veryimportant"
  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }
(161 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0011 was str19 now str20
(4 real changes made)
(7 real changes made)
(219 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0021 was str19 now str20
(1 real change made)
(0 real changes made)
(190 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0031 was str19 now str20
(2 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(157 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0041 was str19 now str20
(8 real changes made)
(6 real changes made)
(144 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0051 was str19 now str20
(10 real changes made)
(4 real changes made)

. 
. ** Importance of environmental projection
. label define important 1 "Not important at all" 2 "Somewhat unimportant" 3 "Ne
> utral" 4 "Somewhat important" 5 "Very important"

. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(important)
  3. }

. 
. rename ta1sq0011_enc env_ms_1

. label var env_ms_1 "Environmental events that historically happened once per c
> entury will occur at least once per year by 2050."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0021_enc env_ms_2

. label var env_ms_2 "Besides greenhouse gas emissions, the earth is approaching
>  many planetary boundaries that demand equal attention"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0031_enc env_ms_3

. label var env_ms_3 "200 million migrants will be moving either within their co
> untries or across borders by 2050"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0041_enc env_ms_4

. label var env_ms_4 "Our planet’s resources are limited and will only sustain a
>  limited population"

. rename ta1sq0051_enc env_ms_5

. label var env_ms_5 "Exponential economic growth cannot be sustained in a finit
> e system like our planet."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. 
. label define yes_no 0 "No" 1 "Yes"

. foreach var in ta1sq0012 ta1sq0022 ta1sq0032 ta1sq0042 ta1sq0052 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(yes_no)
  3. }

. 
. rename ta1sq0012_enc env_ms_1_read 

. label variable env_ms_1_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 1"

. rename ta1sq0022_enc env_ms_2_read

. label variable env_ms_2_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 2"

. rename ta1sq0032_enc env_ms_3_read

. label variable env_ms_3_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 3"

. rename ta1sq0042_enc env_ms_4_read

. label variable env_ms_4_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 4"

. rename ta1sq0052_enc env_ms_5_read

. label variable env_ms_5_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 5"

. 
. label define yes_no_idk 0 "No" 1 "Yes" 99 "Don’t know"

. replace ta2sq001="Don’t know" if ta2sq001=="Don't know"
variable ta2sq001 was str10 now str12
(128 real changes made)

. encode ta2sq001, gen(env_shared_oppinion) label (yes_no_idk)

. label var env_shared_oppinion "Most people in my delegation share opinions on 
> Environmental issues"

. 
. * Env. Knowledge variable
. gen env_know= env_ms_1_read+ env_ms_2_read+ env_ms_3_read+ env_ms_4_read+ env_
> ms_5_read

. label var env_know "How well is the person informed; env_ms_1_read +..+ env_ms
> _5_read"

. 
. 
. 
. ** Outcome variables
. * Acceptable Degree temperature

. lab def conti 1 "Africa" 2 "Asia" 3 "Europe" 4 "North America" 5 "South Americ
> a" 6 "Oceania", replace

. encode continent, gen(continent2) lab(conti)

. drop continent

. rename continent2 continent

. lab var continent "Continent"

> /*
> Specification in left columns
> 
> rename Agriculture edu_agri
> lab var edu_agri "Agricultural education"
> rename Biology edu_bio
> lab var edu_bio "Biological education"
> rename Climateenvironmentalscience edu_cli_env
> lab var edu_cli_env "Climate/Environmental science education"
> rename EconomicsBusiness edu_econ_bus
> lab var edu_econ_bus "Economic/business education"

> lab var edu_law "Law"
> rename Other edu_other_specification
> lab var edu_other_specification "Other education"
> 
> foreach var in edu_agri edu_bio edu_cli_env edu_econ_bus edu_development edu_e
> ngineering {
> replace `var'= 0 if `var'== .
> }
>

> env == 0 & edu_econ_bus == 0 & edu_development == 0 & edu_engineering == 0
> replace edu_other_specification = 0 if edu_agri != 0 | edu_bio != 0 | edu_cli_
> env != 0 | edu_econ_bus != 0 | edu_development != 0 | edu_engineering != 0
> 
> */

> c_social != 0 | educ_social_nat != 0 | educ_engin != 0 | educ_other != 0
>

> ial sciences" 4 "Mix social & natural sciences" 5 "Law" 6 "Engineering" 7 "Oth
> er"

>

> ial_nat educ_engin educ_other env_cli_sust

>

. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
.

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

> 095; 4,096<upper-middle<12,695; high>12,696"

. // Sociodemographics
. * Education
. tab edu, generate(edu)

     Field in which |
  highes degree was |
           obtained |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.

     Social Science |         55       19.86       65.34

                Law |         26        9.39       91.70
              Other |         23        8.30      100.00
--------------------+-----------------------------------
              Total |        277      100.00

. * Organization currently working for
. gen orga = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace orga = 1 if organization == 1 | organization == 2 // International (11
> ) & national (168) gov orga 
(179 real changes made)

. replace orga = 2 if organization == 3 //  University/Research Institute
(33 real changes made)

. replace orga = 3 if organization == 5 //  Environmental NGO
(25 real changes made)

. replace orga = 4 if organization == 4 |  organization == 6 |  organization == 
> 7 //  Private Company (n=8), Non-environmental NGO (n=6), Other (n=26)
(40 real changes made)

. tab organization

         Type of organization |
        currently working for |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------------------------+-----------------------------------
  Internat. Gov. Organization |         11        3.97        3.97
       Nat. Gov. Organization |        168       60.65       64.62

              Private Company |          8        2.89       79.42

        Non-Environmental NGO |          6        2.17       90.61
                        Other |         26        9.39      100.00

                        Total |        277      100.00

> tute" 3 "Environmental NGO" 4 "Other"

. lab val orga orga_lab

                         orga |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.

. // Temperature rise deemed acceptable
. ** Temperature above 1.5 degrees
. gen temp_above = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace temp_above = 0 if temp_rise <= 1.5
(216 real changes made)

. replace temp_above = 1 if temp_rise > 1.5
(61 real changes made)

. lab var temp_above "Temperature rise above 1.5°C deemed acceptable"

. 
. /*
> Very few people suggested temperatures of 2.5°C or higher to be acceptable:
> 2.5°C -> 9
> 3.0°C -> 4
> 3.5°C -> 2
> 4.0°C -> 2
> 4.5°C -> 0
> 5.0°C -> 4
> Therefore, for the illustration Figure 1a all temperature suggestions of 2.5°C
>  or more are summarized under >= 2.5°C
> */
. gen temp_rise2 = temp_rise

. replace temp_rise2 = 2.5 if temp_rise >= 2.5
(12 real changes made)

. tostring temp_rise2, gen(temp_rise3)
temp_rise3 generated as str3

. sort temp_rise

. lab define temp 1 "0" 2 ".5" 3 "1" 4 "1.5", replace

. encode temp_rise3, gen(temp_rise_cropped) lab(temp)

. lab var temp_rise_cropped"All those suggesting 2.5 or more collected in 2.5"

. drop temp_rise2 temp_rise3

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Global carbon price suggested
. ** Logarithmic form of suggested carbon prices
. gen ln_carbon_price = ln(carbon_price + 1)

. label var ln_carbon_price "Natural logarithm of suggested carbon_price"

. 
. ** Cropping global carbon price suggested at USD500 for visualization in figur
> e 1b
. gen carbon_price_cap = carbon_price

. replace carbon_price_cap  = 501 if carbon_price > 500
(23 real changes made)

. lab var carbon_price_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"

. egen mean_carbon_price = mean(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var mean_carbon_price "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"

. egen median_carbon_price = median(carbon_price), by(temp_rise_cropped)

. lab var median_carbon_price "Median carbon price (non-capped)"

. tab temp_rise_cropped , gen(tr)

  All those |
 suggesting |
2.5 or more |
  collected |
     in 2.5 |      Freq.     Percent        Cum.
------------+-----------------------------------
          0 |         22        7.94        7.94
         .5 |         36       13.00       20.94
          1 |         42       15.16       36.10
        1.5 |        116       41.88       77.98
          2 |         40       14.44       92.42
        2.5 |         21        7.58      100.00
------------+-----------------------------------
      Total |        277      100.00

. 
. 
. ** Cropping area-specific carbon prices at USD500 for visualization in figure 
> 1c
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future p
> rice_oecd_future price_ldc_future ln_carbon_price {
  2. gen `var'_cap = `var'
  3. replace `var'_cap  = 501 if `var' > 500
  4. lab var `var'_cap "Carbon price capped at USD500"
  5. egen mean_`var' = mean(`var')
  6. lab var mean_`var' "Mean carbon price (non-capped)"
  7. egen median_`var' = median(`var')
  8. lab var median_`var' "Median carbon price (non-capped)"
  9. }
(13 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(11 real changes made)
(25 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)
(23 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)

. 
. 
. 
. 
.

. ** Price suggested below 60 USD
. * Global price
. gen price_below = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace price_below = 0 if carbon_price >= 60 
(126 real changes made)

. replace price_below = 1 if carbon_price < 60 
(151 real changes made)

. lab var price_below "Price suggested < USD60"

. 
. * National price
. foreach var in now future {
  2.         gen price_below_home_`var' = .
  3.         replace price_below_home_`var' = 0 if price_home_`var' >= 60
  4.         replace price_below_home_`var' = 1 if price_home_`var' < 60
  5.         lab var price_below_home_`var' "Price suggested < USD60"
  6.         }
(277 missing values generated)
(79 real changes made)
(198 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(126 real changes made)
(151 real changes made)

. 
. 
. /*
> Carbon price suggestions tested
> Different models suggest different minimal global carbon prices to stay below 
> a certain temperature rise. In the main paper we use USD60 as thte threshold. 
> As robustness test, we also test against other specifications: 82 USD, 185 USD
> , 281 USD
> */
. * Global carbon price
. foreach i in 37 60 82 185 281 {
  2.         gen price_below_`i' = .
  3.                 replace price_below_`i'= 1 if carbon_price < `i'
  4.                 replace price_below_`i'= 0 if carbon_price >=  `i'
  5.         lab var price_below_`i' "Price below USD `i' suggested"
  6. }
(277 missing values generated)
(119 real changes made)
(158 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(151 real changes made)
(126 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(175 real changes made)
(102 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)

(53 real changes made)
(277 missing values generated)
(241 real changes made)
(36 real changes made)

. 
. * National carbon price (now)
. foreach i in 37 60 82 185 281 {
  2.         gen price_now_below_`i' = .
  3.                 replace price_now_below_`i'= 1 if price_home_now < `i'
  4.                 replace price_now_below_`i'= 0 if price_home_now >=  `i'
  5.         lab var price_now_below_`i' "National price now below USD `i' sugge
> sted"
  6. }
(277 missing values generated)

. ** Shifting
. // Other countries
. * To OECD
. gen shift_to_oecd = price_oecd_now - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_to_oecd "Shift to OECD Countries (if > 0 shift to others)" 

. * To LDCs
. gen shift_to_ldc = price_ldc_now - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_to_ldc "Shift to LD Countries (if > 0 shift to others)" 

. 
. * From LDC to OECD
. gen shift_ldc_oecd = price_oecd_now - price_ldc_now 

. lab var shift_ldc_oecd "Shift from LDC to OECD (if > 0 OECD-countries should p
> ay higher price)"

. 
. // Shifting responsibilties to the future
. * Home Country
. gen shift_future_home = price_home_future - price_home_now 

. lab var shift_future_home "Shift to future: Home (if>0 shift to future)" 

. * OECD Countries
. gen shift_future_oecd = price_oecd_future - price_oecd_now 

. lab var shift_future_oecd "Shift to future: OECD (if>0 shift to future)"

. * Least Developed Countries
. gen shift_future_ldc = price_ldc_future  - price_ldc_now

. lab var shift_future_ldc "Shift to future: Home (if>0 shift to future)"

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. // Region- and time-specific carbon price suggestions
. ** Logarithms of prices suggested prices for home, OECD, LDC / now, future
. foreach var in price_home_now price_oecd_now price_ldc_now price_home_future p
> rice_oecd_future price_ldc_future {
  2. gen ln_`var' = log(`var' + 1)
  3. }

. lab var ln_price_home_now "Ln of Price Home Now"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_now "Ln of Price OECD Now"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_now "Ln of Price LDCs Now"

. lab var ln_price_home_future "Ln of Price Home Future"

. lab var ln_price_oecd_future "Ln of Price OECD Future"

. lab var ln_price_ldc_future "Ln of Price LDCs Future"

. 
. ** Categorizing the ambitions of delegates for prices now and in the future
. gen ambition_home_fut = .
(277 missing values generated)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 1 if price_home_now < 60  & price_home_future < 60
>   // Low ambition
(148 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 2 if price_home_now < 60  & price_home_future >= 6
> 0 // Shift to future
(50 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 3 if price_home_now >= 60 & price_home_future < 60
>   // Shift to now
(3 real changes made)

. replace ambition_home_fut = 4 if price_home_now >= 60 & price_home_future >= 6
> 0 // High ambition
(76 real changes made)

. lab define ambition_fut 1 "Low ambition" 2 "Future pay more" 3 "Now pay more" 
> 4 "High ambition", replace

. lab val ambition_home_fut ambition_fut

. 
.

. // Principal components

. * Winsorized variable of technological optimism (used for robustness test)
. winsor2 tech_ms_pca, suffix(_win) cuts(5 95)

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Program Setup
. *--------------------------------------------------
. clear all               

. *version 16              // Set Version number for backward compatibility
. set more off            

. set linesize 80         

. macro drop _all        

. set matsize 2000
set matsize ignored.
    Matrix sizes are no longer limited by c(matsize) in modern Statas.  Matrix
    sizes are now limited by flavor of Stata.  See limits for more details.

. * -------------------------------------------------
.

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Directory
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. * Max (G-Drive)
. global stata "C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delega
> tes\4_Carbon_Prices\STATA"

. global workpath   "$stata\DO-FILES"

. global datapath   "$stata\DTA-FILES"

. global output     "$stata\OUTPUT"

. global xls        "$stata\XLS-FILES"

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
.

. *--------------------------------------------------
. * Description
. *--------------------------------------------------
. /*
> I) Importing files
> II) Appending files to one dataset
> III) Cleaning
>         i) Renaming & Encoding
> IV) Unifying country-names and assigning to continents
> V) Merge country-specifics
> */
. *--------------------------------------------------
. 
. 
. 
. 
.

. *--------
. * I. Importing files
. *-------------
. *** Treatment 1: Environment
. ** Own delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Own delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) clear
(115 vars, 69 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on environmetnal caution (1) compared to techn. o
> pt. (0)"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Envir. caut" 0 "Tech. Opt"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=1

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", replace
(note: file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\
> 4_Carbon_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta not found)
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_own.dta saved

. 
. 
. 
. 
. ** Others delegation
. import excel "$xls\Ecological-Other delegation.xlsx", firstrow case(lower) cle
> ar
(115 vars, 60 obs)

. 
. gen t_env=1

. label variable t_env "Primed on ecological (1) or economic (0) consequences"

. label define treatment_env 1 "Ecologic" 0 "Economic"

. label values t_env treatment_env

. 
. gen t_own_delegation=0

. label variable t_own_delegation "Asked on own delegation (1) or others delegat
> ion (0)"

. label define treatment_delegation 1 "Own delegation" 0 "Other delegation"

. label values t_own_delegation treatment_delegation

. 
. save "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", replace
(note: file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\
> 4_Carbon_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_others.dta not found)
file C:\Users\Max Burger\Google Drive\Promotion\Projects\Donia_Delegates\4_Carbo
> n_Prices\STATA\DTA-FILES\delegates_ecol_others.dta saved

. *------------
. * II. Appending & merging
. *--------------------
. use "$datapath\delegates_ecol_own.dta", clear

. append using "$datapath\delegates_ecol_others.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq002 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable b4sq004 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd14sq001_sq001 was str21, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str18, now str29 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd6sq004 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6sq006 was str2, now str3 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd6other was str44, now str168 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable lastname was str16, now str30 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_own.dta", force
(note: variable a3sq003 was str15, now str17 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable ta1sq0031 was str18, now str19 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd1other was str86, now str103 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd3other was str50, now str62 to accommodate using data's
       values)
(note: variable sd571057comment was str53, now str98 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd571058comment was str36, now str41 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str34, now str60 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. append using "$datapath\delegates_econ_others.dta", force
(note: variable sd1 was str6, now str17 to accommodate using data's values)
(note: variable sd14sq002_sq001 was str29, now str32 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5sq001comment was str69, now str105 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(note: variable sd5othercomment was str60, now str81 to accommodate using
       data's values)
(label treatment_delegation already defined)
(label treatment_env already defined)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. *----------
. * III. Cleaning
. *----------------
. /*
> Three participants answered the survey twice; same e-mail adress twice in data
> set. For each couple, same name&lastname:
> 
> Date            firstname                               lastname              
>   email
> 04.11.2020      Ram Prasad                              Awasthi               
>   awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 16.02.2021      Ram                                             Awasthi       
>           awasthiramprasad@gmail.com
> 
> 02.12.2020      Nagla                                   Jebory                
>   nagla_fnc@yahoo.com
> 05.11.2020      Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain  Jebory                  nagla_fnc@yaho
> o.com
> 
> 06.11.2020      Augustin                                Ngenzirabona    augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 25.03.2021      Ngenzirablna                    Augustin                augung
> enzi@yahoo.fr
> 
> Keep first entry of each
> */
. drop if firstname == "Ram" & lastname == "Awasthi"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Nagla Mahgoub Hamadain" & lastname == "Jebory"
(1 observation deleted)

. drop if firstname == "Ngenzirablna" & lastname == "Augustin"
(1 observation deleted)

. 
. 
. 
. 
. 
. *** Generate ID
. gen id = _n

. lab var id "ID"

. 
. 
. *** i) Encoding
. ** veryimportant => very important; somewhatunimportant => somewhat unimportan
> t
. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. replace `var'="Very important" if `var'=="Veryimportant"
  3. replace `var'="Somewhat unimportant" if `var'== "Somewhatunimportant"
  4. replace `var'="Not important at all" if `var'== "Notimportant at all"
  5. }
(161 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0011 was str19 now str20
(4 real changes made)
(7 real changes made)
(219 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0021 was str19 now str20
(1 real change made)
(0 real changes made)
(190 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0031 was str19 now str20
(2 real changes made)
(0 real changes made)
(157 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0041 was str19 now str20
(8 real changes made)
(6 real changes made)
(144 real changes made)
variable ta1sq0051 was str19 now str20
(10 real changes made)
(4 real changes made)

. 
. ** Importance of environmental projection
. label define important 1 "Not important at all" 2 "Somewhat unimportant" 3 "Ne
> utral" 4 "Somewhat important" 5 "Very important"

. foreach var in ta1sq0011 ta1sq0021 ta1sq0031 ta1sq0041 ta1sq0051 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(important)
  3. }

. 
. rename ta1sq0011_enc env_ms_1

. label var env_ms_1 "Environmental events that historically happened once per c
> entury will occur at least once per year by 2050."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0021_enc env_ms_2

. label var env_ms_2 "Besides greenhouse gas emissions, the earth is approaching
>  many planetary boundaries that demand equal attention"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0031_enc env_ms_3

. label var env_ms_3 "200 million migrants will be moving either within their co
> untries or across borders by 2050"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename ta1sq0041_enc env_ms_4

. label var env_ms_4 "Our planet’s resources are limited and will only sustain a
>  limited population"

. rename ta1sq0051_enc env_ms_5

. label var env_ms_5 "Exponential economic growth cannot be sustained in a finit
> e system like our planet."
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. 
. label define yes_no 0 "No" 1 "Yes"

. foreach var in ta1sq0012 ta1sq0022 ta1sq0032 ta1sq0042 ta1sq0052 {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(yes_no)
  3. }

.

. label variable env_ms_1_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 1"

> ion 2"

> ion 3"

> ion 4"

. rename ta1sq0052_enc env_ms_5_read

. label variable env_ms_5_read "Read scientific studies on environmental project
> ion 5"

. 
. label define yes_no_idk 0 "No" 1 "Yes" 99 "Don’t know"

. replace ta2sq001="Don’t know" if ta2sq001=="Don't know"
variable ta2sq001 was str10 now str12

> ms_5_read

> _5_read"

> ay below temp_rise"

. 
. * Likelihood of major countries accepting global carbon price

>  realistic" 99 "Don’t know"

. lab var accecpt_global_carbon "Likelihood that all major countries accet globa
> l carbon price until 2050"

> uction" 6 "2% or more GDP reduction"

. *** C: Negotiation Approach 
. label define negotiate 1 "Not reflecting at all" 2 "To a little extent" 3 "To 
> some extent" 4 "To a great extent" 5 "Exactly reflecting"

. foreach var in tc1sq001 tc1sq002 tc139161 tc1sq003 tc1sq004 tc136613 tc1sq005 
> {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label (negotiate)
  3. }

. 
. rename tc1sq001_enc negotiate1

. lab var negotiate1 "Make unrealistic requests to get an acceptable result"

. rename tc1sq002_enc negotiate2

. lab var negotiate2 "Threat to leave the negotiationsto get bargaining power"

. rename tc139161_enc negotiate3

. lab var negotiate3 "Building trust"

. rename tc1sq003_enc negotiate4

. lab var negotiate4 "Keep one’s cards closed an only gradually and tactically o
> pen them"

. rename tc1sq004_enc negotiate5

. lab var negotiate5 "Don't give anything without taking something in return"

. rename tc136613_enc negotiate6

. lab var negotiate6 "Make the first offer to lead and frame the negotiation to 
> own advantage"

. rename tc1sq005_enc negotiate7

. lab var negotiate7 "Assuming multilateral agreements as the only solution to t
> he climate problem"

. *** Economic Quesitons (Treatment B)
. label define agree 1 "Do not agree at all" 2 "Disagree to some extent" 3 "Neut
> ral" 4 "Agree to some extent" 5 "Agree to a great extent"

. foreach var in tb1sq0011 tb1sq0021 tb1sq0031 tb1sq0041 tb1sq0051 tb1sq0061  {
  2. encode `var', gen(`var'_enc) label(agree)
  3. }

. 
. rename tb1sq0011_enc tech_ms_1

. label var tech_ms_1 "Future generations richer and better equipped to deal wit
> h adverse impacts of climate change"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

. rename tb1sq0021_enc tech_ms_2

. label var tech_ms_2 "Technological innovation offers a suitable solution"

. rename tb1sq0031_enc tech_ms_3

. label var tech_ms_3 "The present costs and future benefits to society must be 
> weighed off"

. rename tb1sq0041_enc tech_ms_4

. label var tech_ms_4 "The usage of conventional energy sources is inevitable as
>  global energy demand is too high to be covered by renewable energy"
note: label truncated to 80 characters

> a" 6 "Oceania", replace

. // Development level / Glob. South vs. North (following: UNCTAD https://unctad
> stat.unctad.org/EN/Classifications.html)
. import excel "C:\Users\Max Burger\HESSENBOX\2-Projekte (Björn Vollan)\Paper Su
> stUse\Donia_Delegates\8_Submission\NSUST\analysis\data\country-level indicator
> \DimCountries_All_Hierarchy.xls", sheet("DimCountries_All_Hierarchy") cellrang
> e(C4:D2410) firstrow case(lower) clear
(2 vars, 2,406 obs)

. 
. gen id = _n // Counting number of observation

. gen development = .
(2,406 missing values generated)

. replace development = 1 if id > 739  & id < 811
(71 real changes made)

. replace development = 2 if id > 994  & id < 1128
(133 real changes made)

. replace development = 3 if id > 1128 & id < 1182
(53 real changes made)

. lab define dev 1 "Developped" 2 "Developping" 3 "Least developped countries"

. lab val development dev

. lab var development "Development status"

. 
. gen global_south = .
(2,406 missing values generated)

. replace global_south = 0 if development == 1
(71 real changes made)

. replace global_south = 1 if development == 2 | development == 3 
(186 real changes made)

. lab define global 0 "Global North" 1 "Global South"

. lab val global_south global 

. 
. keep if development != .
(2,149 observations deleted)

. /* 
> 1: CO2 emissions (metric tons per capita)       
> 2: Droughts, floods, extreme temperatures (% of population, average 1990-2009)
> 3: GDP (constant 2015 US$); 
> 4: GDP growth (annual %)
> 5: GDP per capita (constant 2015 US$)
> 6: Population, total
> */
. 
. drop seriesname 

. encode countryname , gen(country_code)

. reshape wide average , i(country_code) j(indicator)
(note: j = 1 2 3 4 5 6)

Data                               long   ->   wide
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Number of obs.                     1596   ->     266
Number of variables                   4   ->       8
j variable (6 values)         indicator   ->   (dropped)
xij variables:
                                average   ->   average1 average2 ... average6
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
